text: Rudolph Ely "Rudy" Boschwitz (born November 7, 1930) is a former American Independent-Republican United States Senator from Minnesota. He served in the Senate from December 1978 to January 1991. In his re-election campaign in 1990, he was defeated by Paul Wellstone. Boschwitz was born in Berlin to a Jewish family. His family moved from Nazi Germany to New York City to escape the Nazis. He was raised in New Rochelle, New York. He studied at New York University. Boschwitz served in the United States Army from 1954 through 1955. He is married to Ellen Boschwitz. Boshwitz now serves on the Board of Directors of the Jewish Institute for National Security Affairs, is an AIPAC Board Member, and is a member of the Council on Foreign Relations. ==References== ==Other websites== * Rudy Boschwitz: An Inventory of His Papers at the Minnesota Historical Society * Category:1930 births Category:Living people Category:German Jews Category:Jewish American politicians Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Politicians from New Rochelle, New York Category:Politicians from Berlin Category:Refugees from Nazism Category:United States senators from Minnesota Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Rudy Boschwitz
